dataSetInformation.common:synonyms: ferromanganese; ferrochromium; ferromolybdenum; ferrotitanium; ferrovanadium; ferrosilicon; ferroboron; ferrophosphorus
ferromanganese; ferrochromium; ferromolybdenum; ferrotitanium; ferrovanadium; ferrosilicon; ferroboron; ferrophosphorus
dataSetInformation.common:generalComment: Ferroalloy refers to various alloys of iron with a high proportion of one or more other elements such as manganese (Mn), aluminium (Al), or silicon (Si). They are used in the production of steels and alloys. The alloys impart distinctive qualities to steel and cast iron or serve important functions during production. The principal ferroalloys are ferromanganese, ferrochromium, ferromolybdenum, ferrotitanium, ferrovanadium, ferrosilicon, ferroboron, and ferrophosphorus. Ferroalloy and silicon production processes are all carbothermic reduction processes, where carbon materials are used to produce the alloys.
铁合金是指由铁与高比例的一种或多种其他元素（如锰（Mn）、铝（Al）或硅（Si））组成的各种合金。它们用于生产钢和合金。合金赋予钢和铸铁独特的品质，或在生产过程中发挥重要作用。主要的铁合金有锰铁、铬铁、钼铁、钛铁、钒铁、硅铁、硼铁和磷铁。铁合金和硅的生产过程都是碳热还原过程，使用碳材料生产合金。
dataSetInformation.sumFormula: Varies based on the type of Ferroalloy
